intro: Stenogyne villosa, commonly known as the hairy stenogyne, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Stenogyne villosa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as mesic forests and rocky areas.
